title.narrative: (GRET) Myanmar Farmers Innovating for Rural development and Environmental restoration, MyFIRE

description.narrative:
Overall objectives are two folded: i) to contribute to livelihoods security and local governance improvement in rural areas of Myanmar and ii) to support the emergence and the strengthening of appropriate services for rural development along with production and dissemination of relevant information for rural farming communities.
As specific objective, innovation focused actions intend at supporting local stakeholders to deliver services enabling sustainable development of rural farming communities and sound natural resource management.
Expected outputs: 1. Micro farmers (landless and resource poor farming households) in Ayeyarwaddy Delta have developed new services that help to diversify their productions and to secure their livelihoods, and are organized collectively to carry out further sustainable development actions. 2. Rural populations of Dry Zone have developed techniques for sustainable watershed management in drought prone regions, got knowledge about economic opportunities of selected value chains and local agents are able to disseminate innovative agro-ecological practice to farmers¿ groups in demand. 3. Specific studies and feasibility assessments for further interventions are carried out as well as capacity building of national staff aiming at the emergence of local experienced development professionals for supporting rural communities in Myanmar
